page.title: 19TOURISM IN BIBURY
page.content: Local people feel that tourists are a mixed blessing. If they treat the countryside with care by taking litter home,respecting privacy and parking considerately, tourists are welcome but not if they walk on the roads and fields when footpaths are available. Tourists help support trade and employment in local shops, hotels, and other attractions. A survey conducted recentlty by the village children found that nearly 40% came from neighbouring counties.About 14% were from overseas, particularly from U.S.A. The majority came by car and parked by the river. Most had been before and were returning for further visits.About 60% had visited the troutfarm and from this it was estimated that about 100,000 people visit Bibury each year.
